intro: Camphora humboldtii, commonly known as the Humboldt's camphor tree, is a species native to the cloud forests of Central America. It is a large evergreen tree that can grow up to 30 meters tall, characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and aromatic bark. The plant produces small, white flowers that are followed by woody, spiny fruits containing several seeds. Its essential oils, derived from the leaves and bark, are used in traditional medicine and as a natural insect repellent. The tree plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing shelter and food for various wildlife species.
